register.description: This register logs the global reset sources, thus contains information regarding the cold/warm reset events generated by global PRCM. Each bit is set upon release of the domain reset signal. Must be cleared by software. This register is insensitive to global warm reset.

bitfield.description: Global warm reset event generated by global PRCM

bitenum.description: Global external warm reset has occurred.

bitfield.description: Power-on (cold) reset event generated by global PRCM
Ramp-up mode selection of HG power chain switch

bitenum.description: Slow ramp-up mode – HG weak chain is used. The delay between PONOUTHG and PGOODINHG is defined by the HG_PONOUT_2_PGDOODIN_TIME bit field.
Fast ramp-up mode – HG weak chain is not used
HG power chain switch is disabled
HG power chain switch is enabled

bitfield.description: The value set in this field determines the slow ramp-up time and the duration (number of cycles) of the PONOUTHG to PGOODINHG (transition for power domain without DPS). The duration is computed as 8 x HG_PONOUT_2_PGDOODIN_TIME of system clock cycles. Target is 10us.
Numerator to be used in fractional incrementor when ABE_LP_CLK clock is used as PRCM clock. Reset value corresponds to ABE_LP_CLK clock = 12.288 MHz.

Numerator to be used in fractional incrementor when SYS_CLK1 is used as PRCM clock.NOTE: The reset value corresponds to SYS_CLK1 = 38.4 MHz. Because the device does not support such SYS_CLK1 frequency, it is SW responsibility to set a value corresponding to one of the SYS_CLK1 frequencies listed in . .

register.description: Reload command and denominator to be used in fractional incrementor

bitfield.description: Reload counter value from coarse counter. 0-&gt;1 transition in this field is used to load the coarse counter into counter.

Denominator to be used in fractional incrementor when when SYS_CLK1 is used as PRCM clock.NOTE: The reset value corresponds to SYS_CLK1 = 38.4 MHz. Because the device does not support such SYS_CLK1 frequency, it is SW responsibility to set a value corresponding to one of the SYS_CLK1 frequencies listed in . .
